intro: Campylostemon pynaertii, commonly known as the African violet. This plant is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its attractive foliage and blooms. The leaves are typically thick and waxy, which helps the plant retain moisture in its natural habitat. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
